ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.Tokenizer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CSSTokenizer, DiffTokenizer, HTMLTokenizer, JavaScriptTokenizer, JavaTokenizer, PlainTextTokenizer, PropertyTokenizer

    public abstract class Tokenizer
extends Object
    A tokenizer is responsible for breaking the lines of a document into lists of Tokens. These identify the general syntactic class of each chunk of text; the syntactic class is mapped to a visual style to be used when painting that chunk in the editor.

    The tokenizer does not store a complete tokenization for the document. Rather, a given line is retokenized on demand whenever its tokenization is required. However, the tokenizer does maintain a small amount of information about each line. In particular, this includes the initial token type for the start of the line. This is needed to create tokenizers for languages that include token types that can span multiple lines, such as multiline comments. For this reason, the tokenizer must be notified when lines are added or deleted from the document being tokenized. If you are using the tokenizer with an editor, the editor will manage this automatically. If you are tokenizing content yourself, you must ensure that you call insertLines(int, int) and add enough lines to hold the content before you begin tokenizing.

    Since:
    2.1

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tokenizer

        public Tokenizer()
        Creates a new instance that does not contain any lines. Before tokenizing any source lines, sufficient space must be reserved by calling insertLines(int, int). (If this is being used with an editor, the editor will manage this automatically.)

    • Method Detail

      • addToken

        protected final void addToken(int length,
                              TokenType type)
        Adds a token to the token list for the line that is currently being tokenized. If the token has length zero, no action will be taken. This method should be called while tokenizing a line as each token is identified.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the token
        type - The id of the token

      • deleteLines

        public final void deleteLines(int index,
                              int lines)
        Informs the token marker that line have been deleted from the document.
        Parameters:
        index - the first line number, from zero
        lines - the number of lines to delete

      • getCodeCompleter

        public CodeCompleter getCodeCompleter()
        Returns a suitable code completer, or null if none is available.
        Returns:
        a code completer, or null

      • getCommentPrefix

        public String getCommentPrefix()
        Returns a prefix that can be prepended to the start of a line to comment it out. Returns null if the language does not have comments. For example, a C-like language could return "//". If the language also requires a suffix to end the comment, it should override getCommentSuffix() to return this.
        Returns:
        a comment prefix string, or null

      • getCommentSuffix

        public String getCommentSuffix()
        Returns a suffix that must be appended to the end of comment to complete it. Returns null if the language does not have comments or only requires a prefix. For example, an HTML-like language might return "-->", while a C-style language that returns "//" as the prefix would return null.
        Returns:
        a comment suffix string, or null

      • getLineCount

        public final int getLineCount()
        Returns the number of lines being managed by this this tokenizer.

      • getNaturalLanguageTokenTypes

        public EnumSet<TokenType> getNaturalLanguageTokenTypes()
        Returns a set of token types that may contain natural language content. For example, in a typical programming language, natural language may appear only in comments and string literals. In contrast, a plain text editor might return a set consisting of the PLAIN token type, or even EnumSet.allOf( TokenType.class ).
        Returns:
        a set of token types that may contain

      • insertLines

        public final void insertLines(int index,
                              int lines)
        Informs the token marker that lines have been inserted into the document.
        Parameters:
        index - the first line number, from zero
        lines - the number of lines to insert

      • install

        public void install(JSourceCodeEditor editor,
                    Tokenizer previous)
        Called when the tokenizer has just been installed into an editor. This gives the tokenizer an opportunity to customize the editor to better suit the target language.
        Parameters:
        editor - the editor being modified
        previous - the previously set tokenizer (may be null)

      • isBraceIndented

        public boolean isBraceIndented()
        Returns true if the format being edited uses indented blocks marked by braces.
        Returns:
        true if the language uses C-style braces

      • isMultilineTokenizationRequired

        public boolean isMultilineTokenizationRequired()
        Returns true if the tokenization of a line can depend on the final state of the previous line. For example, a C-style language must return true because it includes /* comments that can extend over multiple lines. When this returns true, then the editor will ensure that as many lines as necessary are retokenized as the document is edited. If it returns false, then the editor will only retokenize lines that are actually modified.

        Note that it is safe to return true even if the language does not require it. However, incorrectly returning false will result in code that is sometimes tokenized incorrectly.

        Returns:
        true if tokenization depends on the previous line

      • isTokenizationContinuedOnNextLine

        public final boolean isTokenizationContinuedOnNextLine()
        Returns true if the line following the last-tokenized line should also be tokenized.

      • regionMatches

        public static boolean regionMatches(boolean ignoreCase,
                                    Segment text,
                                    int offset,
                                    String target)
        Tests whether a substring within a segment matches a string.
        Parameters:
        ignoreCase - true if the match should be case insensitive
        text - the segment containing the substring to test
        offset - the offset into the segment at which to start matching
        target - the string to test against the segment

      • setTokenizationContinuedOnNextLine

        protected final void setTokenizationContinuedOnNextLine(boolean tokenizeNextLine)
        Sets whether the next line should be retokenized. This must be called from tokenizeImpl(ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.TokenType, javax.swing.text.Segment, int) implementations to indicate that the final token state continues onto the next line.
        Parameters:
        tokenizeNextLine -
        See Also:
        isTokenizationContinuedOnNextLine(), isMultilineTokenizationRequired()

      • tokenize

        public final Token tokenize(Segment line,
                            int lineIndex)
        Returns the Token list for a line of text.
        Parameters:
        line - the text to tokenize
        lineIndex - the zero-based index of the line
        Returns:
        the head of the token list for the line
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the line index is invalid

      • tokenize

        public final Token tokenize(String text,
                            int lineIndex)
        Returns the head of a Token list for a line of text. This is a convenience method that converts the supplied line into a Segment and calls tokenize(javax.swing.text.Segment, int). This is useful for writing utilities that make use of tokenization.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to tokenize
        lineIndex - the zero-based index of the line
        Returns:
        the head of the token list for the line

      • tokenizeImpl

        protected abstract TokenType tokenizeImpl(TokenType type,
                                          Segment line,
                                          int lineIndex)
        Splits a single line of text into tokens. Concrete subclasses must implement this to perform tokenization for the target language. This method should call addToken(int, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.TokenType) for each token in the line, in order from the lowest character offset to the highest character offset.

        This method must return a token type to be used as the initial type for the following line. (The initial token type for line zero is always PLAIN.) For example, if one source line contains a multiline comment that is not terminated on that line, the tokenizer would return a comment token type as the initial token for the next line. When the next line is tokenized, it would receive this initial token type and so continue tokenizing the comment instead of treating the next line as uncommented code.

        Note that if the tokenizer does not depend on the initial token type, then you can override isMultilineTokenizationRequired() to return false in order to boost tokenization performance.

        Parameters:
        type - the initial token type for the line
        line - the line to be tokenized
        lineIndex - the zero-based index of the line in the document
        Returns:
        the initial token type for the next line

      • uninstall

        public void uninstall(JSourceCodeEditor editor,
                      Tokenizer next)
        Called when the tokenizer has just been uninstalled from an editor. The tokenizer can undo any customization it performed in install(ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.JSourceCodeEditor, ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.Tokenizer).
        Parameters:
        editor - the editor being modified
        next - the next tokenizer that will be set (may be null)
